text: The 1980 United States Senate election in New Hampshire was held on November 4, 1980. Incumbent Democratic U.S. Senator John Durkin was defeated by attorney Warren Rudman in a relatively close election, where nationwide Republicans would have a landslide election known as the Reagan Revolution. == Candidates == === Democratic === * John Durkin, incumbent U.S. Senator === Republican === * Warren Rudman, former Attorney General of New Hampshire == Results == == See also == * United States Senate elections, 1980 1980 New Hampshire Category:1980 New Hampshire elections
title: 1980 United States Senate election in New Hampshire
